Package api

Interface Game

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGame, BasicGame, SampleGame
public interface Game
Interface for a Tetris-like game. Implementations of this interface should maintain all aspects of the game state. The state consists of a grid of Icon objects representing occupied and unoccupied positions, plus a current Piece whose position is normally updated by the step() method and can be altered by the transform(), shiftDown(), shiftLeft(), and shiftRight() methods. An additional part of the game state is the status that is returned by each invocation of the step() method. The status values are described in detail in the GameStatus documentation.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    cycle()
    Performs a cycle() operation on the current piece.
    boolean
    gameOver()
    Determines whether the game is over, which occurs when a new piece in its initial position collides with occupied cells of the grid.
    Piece
    getCurrent()
    Returns the current piece.
    int
    getHeight()
    Returns the height of the grid.
    Icon
    getIcon(int row, int col)
    Returns the icon associated with the given row and column, or null if the location is unoccupied.
    List<Position>
    getPositionsToCollapse()
    Returns the grid positions to be collapsed.
    Piece
    getPreview()
    Returns the next piece to be dropped.
    int
    getScore()
    Returns the current score for this game.
    int
    getWidth()
    Returns the width of the grid.
    boolean
    shiftLeft()
    Shifts the current piece one cell to the left (decreasing the column), if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
    boolean
    shiftRight()
    Shifts the current piece one cell to the right (increasing the column), if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
    GameStatus
    step()
    Transition the game through one discrete step.
    boolean
    transform()
    Performs a transform() operation on the current piece if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.

  • Method Details

    • step

      GameStatus step()
      Transition the game through one discrete step. A step may consist of
      • shifting the current piece down by one cell
      • changing the status to COLLAPSING when when the current shape cannot be dropped further and completes a collapsible set (e.g., in a standard Tetris game, a collapsible set would be a completed horizontal row)
      • changing the status to STOPPED when the current piece cannot be dropped further, but does not complete a collapsible set
      • changing the status to NEW_SHAPE when a new piece is started at the top of the grid
      • deleting all cells to be collapsed
      • changing the status to GAME_OVER when a new piece collides with occupied positions in the top row
      Returns:
      the game status after the step

    • transform

      boolean transform()
      Performs a transform() operation on the current piece if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
      Returns:
      true if the current piece was moved, false otherwise

    • cycle

      void cycle()
      Performs a cycle() operation on the current piece.

    • shiftLeft

      boolean shiftLeft()
      Shifts the current piece one cell to the left (decreasing the column), if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
      Returns:
      true if the current piece was moved, false otherwise

    • shiftRight

      boolean shiftRight()
      Shifts the current piece one cell to the right (increasing the column), if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
      Returns:
      true if the current piece was moved, false otherwise

    • getIcon

      Icon getIcon(int row, int col)
      Returns the icon associated with the given row and column, or null if the location is unoccupied.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the cell
      col - the column of the cell
      Returns:
      the icon associated with the given row/column in the grid

    • getCurrent

      Piece getCurrent()
      Returns the current piece.
      Returns:
      the current piece.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the game status is COLLAPSING or GAME_OVER

    • getPreview

      Piece getPreview()
      Returns the next piece to be dropped.
      Returns:
      the next piece.

    • getWidth

      int getWidth()
      Returns the width of the grid.
      Returns:
      the width of the grid.

    • getHeight

      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of the grid.
      Returns:
      the height of the grid.

    • getPositionsToCollapse

      List<Position> getPositionsToCollapse()
      Returns the grid positions to be collapsed. This method can only be called when the game state is COLLAPSING. The returned list is has no duplicates and is ordered according to the compareTo method of the Position class. (The purpose of this method is to allow clients to apply special rendering or animation to the collapsing positions.)
      Returns:
      list of Position objects representing the the grid positions to be collapsed
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the game status is not COLLAPSING

    • getScore

      int getScore()
      Returns the current score for this game.
      Returns:
      the current score for this game

    • gameOver

      boolean gameOver()
      Determines whether the game is over, which occurs when a new piece in its initial position collides with occupied cells of the grid.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise
